channel.title: Communism or Capitalism?
channel.description:
Well, what do you prefer?
I prefer Capitalism. It forces people to develop themselve if they want to be succesfull. This way you get a higher educated population. In a Communistic country everyone gets a job without much trouble. Everyone has a job, but someone who sweeps the street earns the same as someone who automates production. Salaries are virtually the same for everyone, so noone will be motivated to put some effort in to there work and get promoted. In a communistic country, you can't own a bussiness. Everything is owned by the state. You might say, that's great, lower costs for civilians. But lower costs mean lower salaries. Lower salaries mean less expenditure, and if you get in to small problems, you come into a downward spiral. If state owned companies lose money, the state has to fall in. In a Communistic country you can't force people to pay a lot of taxes, so the country has to create more money. This causes massive inflation.
So, if a country is capitalistic, more people enjoy a high education. More people will try to get higher on the social ladder and have a succesfull career. If you let the market do it's work, almost all problems solve itself. The current economic crisis will solve itself eventually. Many banks will disappear, but the strong ones will survive. The survivors can't raise their prices, if they do they get more competition which makes the prices drop again. Competition causes the prices to drop, so it's better for the consumers.
Discuss.

item.title: Communism or Capitalism?
item.dc:creator: @The_Reaper_X The Reaper X
item.description:
@The_Reaper_X wrote:

It wasn’t serious. It was used as a joke, if you want me to say that im possitive, then i will. But whatever.

[quote=“bowserjr2, post:33, topic:231472”][quote author=The Reaper X link=topic=304855.msg2454708#msg2454708 date=1222169832]

the communist manifesto was simply a model created by Karl Marx to overthrow class struggle… he realized that capitalists controlled means of production and therefore controlled law and economy. he wrote it during the industrial revolution, while he was witnessing several demographic and technological changes… they don’t apply to today. you can’t just say what one would you choose… there are several options… so to your question… neither
[/quote]pretty sure you can choose either communist or capitalist. They have to fall under one or the other.

There is a several options, one is Social Democracy.
So there is no need to just choose between Communism and Capitalism.[/quote]But what was the question up for discussion? your options are Communism and Capitalism. No “others”. If your “other” falls under one of those, why don’t you just say what it falls under. Thats what I’m trying to say.

Read full topic

So there is no need to just choose between Communism and Capitalism.

im sorry but they both stink… this world is a kill or be killed world… no one cares how they run it as long as there happy and thats that.

Would you like the world how it was before, only rich people was heard by the government, rich people got richer and poor got poorer, that was after my meaning capitalism.
They who had money rule the world.

But Karl Marx(Communism) want to remove the classes in the society (But this is impossible, since there allways will be a higher class that that decide), there all have the same rigths.

Capitalism is good if you are rich.
Communism is good if you not are rich.

item.title: Communism or Capitalism?
item.dc:creator: @cooper cooper
item.description:
@cooper wrote:

Communism.

The motivation is to forward the state and to benefit the people, not just yourself. Of course, it doesn’t always work that way. Animal Farm is a great example of this.
Snowball is the leader who works for the people, Napoleon is the leader who works for himself/the other pigs.
Boxer is the worker who works for his country, Mollie is the worker who slacks off because she’ll get her food either way.

IMO communism isn’t flawed, it’s some of the people who have been involved with it that are. You could say it is flawed because it doesn’t always work with the people, but almost every government will one day fall and be replaced.

Read full topic
